actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 101-127.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 87.
Mr. Campbell (CO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Craig demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Mining and Natural Resources
Subcommittee on Mineral Resources Development and Production

official_title: To amend the Mining and Minerals Policy Act of 1970, and for other purposes.
short_title: Mining and Minerals Policy Act Amendments of 1989

summary.text: Mining and Minerals Policy Act Amendments of 1989 - Amends the Mining and Minerals Policy Act of 1970 to declare that: (1) Federal assistance to foreign mining ventures does not serve U.S. national security and economic interests; (2) acceleration of Federal efforts to reduce U.S. dependency on foreign sources of minerals, especially critical minerals, is in the national interest; and (3) it is the responsibility of all Federal entities to carry out the national interest when exercising their program authorities.
